Blog - United Catalyst Corporationhttp://www.unitedcatalystcorporation.com/blog/Tue, 17 Dec 2013 16:51:11 +0000en-USSite Server v6.0.0 (http://www.squarespace.com)Get the latest information on Converter IDentification (CID) Systems™  What's New for 2014?Becky BerubeTue, 17 Dec 2013 16:33:53 +0000http://www.unitedcatalystcorporation.com/blog/2013/12/17/whats-new-for-2014525db8bce4b0fe5f6688ecb7:526fbd65e4b0f2fbdf3851e2:52b076e2e4b030d7cf1735c6Do more in 2014 with your converter recycling program. What an exciting year 2013 has been for United Catalyst Corporation and the recyclers and converter manufacturers that are participating in Converter IDentification (CID) Systems™. The coming year should be even more eventful for the CID Systems™ co-operative with several promising developments on the horizon. What an exciting year 2013 has been for United Catalyst Corporation and the recyclers and converter manufacturers that are participating in Converter IDentification (CID) Systems™. Together we are processing tons of scrap catalytic converters and testing units and groups by year/make/model/VIN - returning true value to our group without grading and counting concerns. 

The coming year should be even more eventful for the CID Systems™ co-operative with several promising developments on the horizon. Just ask us, we will be happy to share the details with you.

The holidays are a great time to relax with family and friends, but it is also a wonderful time to start something new in a week or two. CID Systems™ offers you transparency, reliability, and the flexibility to do more with your scrap catalytic converter recycling program than ever before.

What are you waiting for? Book your loads with us today, before you head off for the holidays, and ensure that the start of 2014 will have you in the green.   

Wishing you and yours peace and prosperity this holiday.

Becky T. Berube
President
United Catalyst Corporation

]]>What's New for 2014?Converter IDentification (CID) Systems™ - Data in hand, cash in the drawerBecky BerubeTue, 29 Oct 2013 13:51:42 +0000http://www.unitedcatalystcorporation.com/blog/2013/10/29/converter-identification-cid-systems-data-in-hand-cash-in-the-drawer525db8bce4b0fe5f6688ecb7:526fbd65e4b0f2fbdf3851e2:526fbd8fe4b0cc4d8c57a9b9Converter IDentification (CID) Systems™ is helping recyclers get what they want from their scrap catalytic converters – data in hand and cash in the drawer. Know the value of the converter by make/model and VIN upfront before you buy the car or cat. Get paid how you need to – when you need to – without compromising full value.

Converters are not just another core. They are a precious metals commodity. These are the metals that should be sold after processing and refining so that the true end-of-life value of the converter can be revealed.

It takes a leading expert in both processing and refining to manage an assay-based catalytic converter recycling program. United Catalyst Corporation offers recyclers 20 years expertise in both areas. Scientifically accurate and reliable results every time from a leading global refiner, assay-based selling can effectively eliminate grading and pricing issues associated with selling converters by the piece.

United Catalyst Corporation is an independent processor of scrap catalytic converters and converter testing facility. The company is the creator of Converter IDentification (CID) Systems™, a partnership with North American recyclers and converter manufacturers, to process, test, and refine all scrap catalytic converters by make/model and VIN, returning true value for this commodity to the recycler.

Know true converter values. Become a recycling partner with United Catalyst Corporation and reap the benefits of Converter IDentification (CID) Systems™. It’s your commodity, learn to manage it.

Attending the ARA Convention in Phoenix, AZ, next week? Call (864) 834-2003 to set up an individual meeting and presentation time.
